com.camerontec.util.concurrent.circularbuffer

Class SpinBarrier

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.concurrent.circularbuffer.BarrierBase
      • com.camerontec.util.concurrent.circularbuffer.SpinBarrier
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Barrier
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SpinAndYieldBarrier

    public class SpinBarrier
extends BarrierBase
    Base implementation of a spinning (i.e. busy/wait or non-blocking) barrier for use in conjunction with a SingleConsumerCircularBuffer.

    When the required sequence number is not available the calling thread is held in a busy/wait loop until it becomes available. Therefore this base implementation is suitable in which there are fewer threads than available cores.

    This class is, however, also designed to be sub-classed (via nonBlockingPause(int)to provided less resource intensive behavior.

        Parameters:

      • initialSpinCount

        public final int initialSpinCount()

      • await

        public final long await(long sequenceNumber,
                        PaddedLong gatingSequenceNumber)
                 throws InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: Barrier
        Wait indefinitely or interrupted for the specified sequence number to become available.
        Parameters:
        sequenceNumber - The desired sequence number.
        gatingSequenceNumber - The sequence number on which we are awaiting.
        Returns:
        The maximum sequence number available. This is guaranteed to be ≥ the desired sequence number.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - On being interrupted while waiting for the specified sequence number.

      • nonBlockingPause

        protected int nonBlockingPause(int spinCount)
        Sub-class hook to provide less resource intensive behavior.

        This method is guaranteed to be called exactly once every time the required sequence number is not available.

        Parameters:
        spinCount - The current spin count. This will be whatever was returned the last time this method was invoked (or the initial value on the first invocation).
        Returns:
        The new spin count.

      • await

        public final long await(long sequenceNumber,
                        long timeout,
                        TimeUnit timeUnit,
                        PaddedLong gatingSequenceNumber)
                 throws InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: Barrier
        Wait for the specified sequence number to become available or the timeout expires, whichever occurs first.
        Parameters:
        sequenceNumber - The desired sequence number.
        timeout - The maximum wait time. If this is ≤0 then the method returns immediately (i.e. does not wait) regardless of whether the desired sequence number is available or not.
        timeUnit - The timeout units.
        gatingSequenceNumber - The sequence number on which we are awaiting.
        Returns:
        The maximum sequence number available, or Barrier.UNAVAILABLE_SEQUENCE_NUMBER if the specified sequence number did not become available inside the timeout period.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - On being interrupted while waiting for the specified sequence number.

      • signalAll

        public void signalAll()
        Description copied from interface: Barrier
        Signal all waiters that at least one new sequence number is available.
